ptxt.intxrefpoff: Compressor Assembly On-Vehicle Inspection:J24B and N32A Model

s1.ptxt: Run engine at idle with A/C ON for 10 minutes.
Recover refrigerant from the A/C system using recovery and recycling equipment referring to “Recovery” in Operation Procedure for Charging A/C with Refrigerant:J24B and N32A Model .

attention3.ptxt: The amount of compressor oil at removed must be measured and the same amount must be poured when installing the compressor.

s1.ptxt: Remove radiator inside hose and outside hose from engine.
Remove P/S fluid reservoir from its bracket.
Remove accessory (A/C compressor) drive belt referring to Accessory Drive Belt Removal and Installation:J24B and N32A .
Disconnect suction hose (2) and discharge hose (3) from compressor.

attention3.ptxt: Cap open fitting immediately to keep moisture out of system.

servinfosub.title: Installation

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to use HFC-134a (R-134a) compressor oil.

servinfosub.ptxt: Reverse removal procedure noting the following instructions.

item.ptxt: If compressor is replaced, pour new compressor oil referring to Precautions on Replenishing Compressor Oil:J24B and N32A Model .
Install accessory (A/C compressor) drive belt referring to Accessory Drive Belt Removal and Installation:J24B and N32A .
Install P/S fluid reservoir from its bracket.
Evacuate and charge system referring to “Evacuation” and “Charge” in Operation Procedure for Charging A/C with Refrigerant:J24B and N32A Model .
Tighten compressor mounting bolts in numerical order (“1” through “3”) to specified torque as shown in figure. (J24B model)

Tighten compressor mounting bolts “2” temporarily and install mounting bolt “1” and “3”, and then tighten mounting bolts in numerical order (“1” through “3”) to specified torque as shown in figure. (N32A model)
